title: Arsenal Meetings and Events launch The Hub
text:
Arsenal Meetings and Events launch The Hub Arsenal Meetings and Events launch The Hub Details Created   12:30 New indoor multi-purpose sport and activity facility at the Emirates Stadium Arsenal Meetings and Events have launched The Hub, a new indoor multi-purpose sport and activity facility, to the event industry. Sitting alongside the home of Arsenal F.C. the Emirates Stadium, The Hub, is a versatile event space, created with teambuilding activities in mind. The 50 metre by 18 metre 4G pitch can double up to host any number of popular teambuilding activities, including dodgeball, archery, netball and even duck herding, as well as football. 
Capable of hosting up to 300 delegates in the pitch area, the pitch can be split into sections to hold different activities simultaneously. The Hub also has adjoining facilities, including changing rooms, catering areas, bespoke branding opportunities and two meeting rooms, holding up to 40 theatre style, which can be used by the organiser. Emirates Stadium boasts four main event suites, as well as luxurious dining areas and private meeting rooms, all of which are available for organisers to book in conjunction with The Hub. The multitude of event spaces at The Hub and Emirates Stadium allowing organisers to combine The Hub with other event options, such as conferences, exhibitions, meetings, private dining experiences and large-scale dinners. The offering at The Hub has already attracted a number of blue-chip clients, including Largardere, Ernst & Young and Thomson Reuters, who are using the combination of The Hub and the Stadium’s pre-existing leading event spaces. Carlo Zoccali, Arsenal Meetings and Events Manager, said: “We’re thrilled to announce The Hub at Emirates Stadium. We have a huge amount to offer at the stadium, including versatile event spaces, unique dining experiences, tours and the flexibility to adapt to any event brief. To be able to offer a fantastic indoor space for any type of teambuilding activity just completes the package.” Related articles
